abstract: Senate investigation finds mismanagement at IRS resulted in it improperly targeting conservative groups seeking tax-exempt status; report stops short of suggesting laws were broken; Republicans claim treatment of groups was politically motivated, assertion Democrats refute.
lead_paragraph: A report released by the bipartisan panel said the Internal Revenue Service improperly targeted conservative groups seeking tax-exempt status but it did not suggest that any laws were broken.

headline.main: Senate Report Cites I.R.S. Mismanagement in Targeting of Tea Party Groups
headline.print_headline: Senate Report Cites Mismanagement in I.R.S. Targeting of Tea Party Groups

snippet: A report released by the bipartisan panel said the Internal Revenue Service improperly targeted conservative groups seeking tax-exempt status but it did not suggest that any laws were broken.
